United States state and county level data from USAFacts

Source: R/beoutbreakprepared.R
beoutbreakprepared_data.Rd

United States state and county level data from USAFacts

beoutbreakprepared_data(quietly = TRUE)

Arguments

quietly

logical(1) defaults to TRUE. If FALSE, warnings generated during parsing will be displayed. These often relate to nonstandard date values that occur idiosyncratically.

Source

https://github.com/beoutbreakprepared/nCoV2019

Value

tidy data.frame of content

Note

This is individual level data, collected upstream of this package from diverse sources. Date values in particular can be non-standard. If you wish to introduce corrections for poorly formated data, see the argument to read.csv in the source code of this function and acquire the table manually.

See also

Other data-import: covidtracker_data(), jhu_data(), kff_icu_beds(), nytimes_county_data(), us_county_geo_details(), us_healthcare_capacity(), usa_facts_data()

Examples

res = beoutbreakprepared_data()
#> using temporary cache /tmp/RtmpjoOP26/BiocFileCache
colnames(res)
